item.title: AK-1 West - Bragaw St.
item.description: AK-1 West at the Bragaw St. interchange. This is the last exit on the Glenn Highway freeway, before the freeway ends and becomes East 5th Ave.

item.title: AK-1 West - Boniface Parkway
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Boniface Parkway/Mountain View Drive/JBER-Elmendorf. JBER stands for Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson and is US Military facility.

item.title: AK-1 West - Muldoon Road
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Muldoon Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - JBER - Richardson/Arctic Valley
item.description: AK-1 West approaching JBER - Richardson/Arctic Valley interchange. JBER stands for Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson, a US Military installation.

item.title: AK-1 West - Eagle River Loop Road/Hiland Road
item.description: AK-1 West - Eagle River Loop Road/Hiland Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Eagle River
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Eagle River interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - North Eagle River
item.description: AK-1 west approaching North Eagle River interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Chugiak/South Birchwood
item.description: AK-1 West approaching Chugiak/South Birchwood interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Chugiak/North Birchwood
item.description: AK-1 West approaching Chugiak/North Birchwood interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Peters Creek
item.description: AK-1 West at Peters Creek interchange.

item.title: AK-1 North - North Peters Creek
item.description: AK-1 north approaching North Peters Creek interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Mirror Lake
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Mirror Lake interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Eklunta
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Eklunta interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Old Glenn Highway
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Old Glenn Highway interchange.

item.title: AK-1 West - Knik River Access
item.description: AK-1 west approaching Knik River Access interchange.

item.title: AK-3 South Approaching AK-1
item.description: AK-3 South (George Parks Highway) approaching AK-1 (Glenn Highway). Use next right for AK-1 East to Palmer and Glenallen. Continue on freeway for AK-1 west to Anchorage. AK-3 ends at this interchange.

item.title: AK-3 South Approaching AK-1 Jct.
item.description: AK-3 South (George Parks Highway) approaching AK-1 East/Palmer interchange.

item.title: AK-3 South - Next Exits
item.description: Next exits on AK-3 south: Trunk Road and AK-1/Glenn Hwy. Jct.

item.title: AK-3 South - Trunk Road
item.description: AK-3 south approaching Trunk Road interchange.

item.title: AK-3 South - Fairview Loop/Hyer Road
item.description: AK-3 South at Fairview Loop/Hyer Road interchange.

item.title: AK-3 South - Seward Meridian Parkway
item.description: AK-3 South approaching Seward Meridian Parkway interchange. This is the beginning of the freeway southbound.

item.title: AK-3 South - Wasilla
item.description: AK-3 South in Wasilla.

item.title: AK-3 South - Big Lake
item.description: AK-3 south at Big Lake jct. Continue straight on AK-3 for Wasilla.

item.title: AK-3 South - Hatcher Pass Jct.
item.description: AK-3 south at Hatcher Pass (Willow-Fishook Road) Junction. Continue south on AK-3 for Wasilla and Anchorage.

item.title: AK-3 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-3 south. Distance to Wasilla and Anchorage.

item.title: AK-3 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-3 (George Parks Highway) south. Distance to Willow and Anchorage.

item.title: End AK-8 West at AK-3
item.description: End AK-8 West (Denali Highway) at AK-3 (George Parks Highway) in Cantwell.

item.title: AK-8 West - Denali Borough
item.description: Entering Denali Borough on AK-8 west (Denali Highway).

item.title: AK-8 West - Susitna River
item.description: AK-8 West (Denali Highway) at Susitna River bridge.

item.title: AK-8 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-8 west. Distance to Cantwell. Cantwell is where the Denali Highway ends at the Parks Highway.

item.title: AK-8 West - Matanuska-Susitna Borough
item.description: Entering the Matanuska-Susitna Borough on AK-8 west (Denali Highway).

item.title: AK-4 North - Hazelet Ave. at Egan Ave
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) on Hazelet Ave. at Egan Ave. Turn right on Egan Ave. to continue north on AK-4 to Glenallen, Anchorage, and Fairbanks.

item.title: AK-8 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-8 west. Distance to Tangle Lakes, Cantwell, and Denali National Park.

item.title: AK-8 West - State Speed Limit
item.description: AK-8 West (Denali Highway) - State Speed Limit 50 MPH. Denali Highway is closed durning the winter months. The first 20 miles from Paxson to Tangle Lakes are paved. The remaining 114 miles are gravel.

item.title: AK-4 North at AK-8 West - Paxson
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) at AK-8 West (Denali Highway) in Paxson. Use AK-8 west for Denali National Park. Continue north on AK-4 for Delta Jct. and Fairbanks.

item.title: AK-4 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-4 North (Richardson Highway). Distance to Paxson, Delta, and Fairbanks.

item.title: AK-1/AK-4 North at AK-1 North - Gakona Junction
item.description: AK-1/AK-4 North at AK-1 North - Gakona Junction. AK-1/AK-4 split here. Turn right for AK-1 north to Tok. Continue straight for AK-4 north to Fairbanks.

item.title: AK-1 North at AK-4 - Glenallen
item.description: AK-1 North (Glenn HIghway) at AK-4 (Richardson Highway) in Glenallen. Use AK-4 south for Valdez; AK-4 North/AK-1 North for Fairbanks and Canada (via AK-2 - Alaska Highway).

item.title: AK-1 North at AK-4 - Glenallen
item.description: AK-1 North (Glenn Highway) at AK-4 (Richardson Highway) in Glenallen. AK-1 north joins AK-4 north to Gulkana Junction.

item.title: AK-1 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-1 south. Distance to Glenallen, Palmer, and Anchorage.

item.title: AK-4 North at AK-1
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) at AK-1 (Glenn Highway) junction in Glenallen. AK-1 north joins AK-4 north to Gakona Junction.

item.title: AK-4 North Approaching AK-1
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) approaching AK-1 (Glenn Highway). AK-1 joins AK-4 northhbound to Gakona Junction. Use AK-1 south to Anchorage; use AK-1 North/AK-4 North to Tok Jct. and Fairbanks.

item.title: AK-4 North - Copper Center Jct.
item.description: AK-4 north at Copper Center Jct. This is the south end of the loop into the community of Copper Center.

item.title: AK-4 North - Richardson Highway
item.description: AK-4 North shield on the Richardson Highway.

item.title: AK-4 North at AK-10 East
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) at AK-10 East (Edgerton Highway) to Chitina.

item.title: AK-4 North Approaching AK-10
item.description: AK-4 North (Richardson Highway) approaching AK-10 (Edgerton Highway).

item.title: AK-4 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-4 north (Richardson Highway). Distance to Copper Center and Glenallen.

item.title: AK-4 North - Pump Station Number 12
item.description: AK-4 north (Richardson Highway) at Pump Station Number 12. This is a pump station for the Trans Alaska Pipeline.

item.title: AK-4 North - Valdez
item.description: First AK-4 north shield along the Richardson Highway in Valdez.

item.title: Portage Glacier Highway at Ferry Terminal
item.description: End Portage Glacier Highway at the Whittier Ferry Terminal for the Alaska Marine Highway system.

item.title: AK-1 North - Portage Glacier Jct.
item.description: AK-1 north (Seward Highway) approaching Portage Glacier Rd./Whittier Jct.

item.title: AK-1 North - Passing Lane Speeds
item.description: Passing lane with different speed per lane on AK-1 north between Turnagain Pass and Girdwood. There are a few passing lanes near Turnagain Pass that have a faster speed limit on the passing lane than in the right lane.

item.title: AK-1 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker and AK-1 shield along AK-1 (Seward Highway) north. Distance to Girdwood, Whittier (via Portage Glacier Highway), and Anchorage.

item.title: AK-1 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-1 north. Distance to Girdwood, Whittier (via Portage Glacier Hwy) and Anchorage.

item.title: AK-1 North - Seward Highway
item.description: AK-1 north (Seward Highway) at Tern Lake Junction.

item.title: End AK-9 North at AK-1
item.description: End AK-9 North at AK-1 at Tern Lake Junction. Turn left for AK-1 south (Sterling Highway); continue straight for AK-1 north (Seward Highway).

item.title: End AK-9 North at AK-1
item.description: End AK-9 north at AK-1. Turn left for AK-1 south for the Sterling Highway south to Soldotna, City of Kenai, and Homer. Continue north on AK-1 for the Seward Highway north to Anchorage.

item.title: End AK-9 North at AK-1
item.description: End AK-9 North at AK-1 (Sterling Highway). Seward Highway continues northbound along AK-1.

item.title: AK-9 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-9 (Seward Highway) north. Distance to Sterling Highway - 5 Miles.

item.title: AK-9 North - Moose Pass
item.description: Entering the community of Moose Pass on AK-9 North (Seward Highway).

item.title: AK-9 North - Seward
item.description: First AK-9 shield northbound along 3rd Ave. in Seward. Speed limit 25 MPH.

item.title: AK-9 North - Resurrection River
item.description: Resurrection River bridge on AK-9 north.

item.title: AK-9 South - Seward
item.description: Last AK-9 shield along AK-9 south in Seward.

item.title: AK-9 South - Seward
item.description: Seward City Limits on AK-9 South (Seward Highway). Seward is the southern end of the Seward Highway, and is located on the Kenai Peninsula. It is also the southern end of the Alaska Railroad. Seward is named after Abraham Lincoln’s secretary of State - William H. Seward. Secretary Seward negotiated the sale of Alaska from Russia to the United States.

item.title: AK-9 South - Resurrection River
item.description: AK-9 south (Seward Highway) crossing the Resurrection River. The Resurrection River flows into the ocean at Resurrection Bay just south of this bridge.

item.title: AK-9 South - Seward Highway
item.description: First AK-9 shield southbound on the Seward Highway. Tern Lake is in the background.

item.title: AK-1 South/AK-9 South Junction
item.description: AK-1 South at AK-9. Merge right to continue south on AK-1 as the Sterling Highway to Homer. Continue straight to continue south on the Seward Highway as AK-9.

item.title: AK-1 South Approaching AK-9
item.description: AK-1 South (Seward Highway) approaching AK-9. Merge right to continue south on AK-1 as the Sterling Highway to Soldotna, City of Kenai, and Homer.

item.title: AK-1 South Approaching AK-9
item.description: AK-1 South (Seward Highway) approaching AK-9 (Seward Highway). AK-1 traffic will merge right at this junction and becomes the Sterling Highway. AK-9 continues south as the Seward Highway.

item.title: AK-1 South - Hope Jct.
item.description: AK-1 South at Hope Jct. Hope is 17 miles north of this junction. Continue south on AK-1 for Seward (via AK-9) and Homer (via AK-1 / Sterling Highway).

item.title: AK-1 South Approaching Hope Jct.
item.description: AK-1 South (Seward Highway) approaching Hope Jct.

item.title: AK-1 South - Turnagain Pass
item.description: AK-1 south (Seward Highway) at Turnagain Pass - Elevation 1015 Feet. Turnagain Pass is the highest point on the Seward Highway.

item.title: AK-1 South - Portage Glacier Jct.
item.description: AK-1 South (Seward Highway) approaching Portage Glacier/Whittier junction. Access to Whittier via the Anton Anderson Memorial Tunnel, which shares rail traffic with automobile traffic.

item.title: AK-1 South - Alyeska Highway
item.description: AK-1 south at Alyeska Highway junction. Turn left for Alyeska Ski Area and Girdwood.

item.title: AK-1 South - Alyeska Highway
item.description: AK-1 South approaching Alyeska Highway junction. Use Alyeska Highway for Girdwood and the Alyeska Ski Resort.

item.title: AK-1 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on AK-1 south. Distance to Girdwood, Seward, and Homer (via Sterling Highway).

item.title: AK-1 South - Old Seward Highway/Rabbit Creek Road
item.description: AK-1 South at Old Seward Highway/Rabbit Creek Road interchange. The freeway along the Seward Highway ends just south of here.

item.title: AK-1 South - Old Seward Highway/Rabbit Creek Road
item.description: AK-1 South approaching Old Seward Highway/Rabbit Creek Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - DeArmoun Road
item.description: AK-1 South at DeArmoun Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - Huffman Road
item.description: AK-1 south at Huffman Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - O'Malley Road
item.description: AK-1 south at O’Malley Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - Dimond Blvd./Abbot Road
item.description: AK-1 south at Dimond Blvd./Abbot Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - 76th Ave.
item.description: AK-1 south approaching 76th Ave. interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - Dowling Road
item.description: AK-1 south approaching Dowling Road interchange.

item.title: AK-1 South - Tudor Road
item.description: AK-1 south approaching Tudor Road interchange.

item.title: East 6th Ave. at Gambell St. - Glenn and Seward Highways
item.description: East 6th Ave. at Glenn and Seward Highway junction. Turn right for the Seward Highway (AK-1 South) to Seward. Continue straight on East 6th Ave. for Palmer and the Glenn Highway. The Seward Highway and Glenn Highway both begin here.

item.title: East 6th St. at Seward Highway/Glenn Highway
item.description: East 6th St. at Seward Highway/Glenn Highway junction. Turn right (Gambell St.) for AK-1 south and the Seward Highway. Continue straight for AK-1 north and the Glenn Highway.

item.title: AK-1 South - Glenn Highway at Seward Highway Jct.
item.description: AK-1 south (East 5th Ave.) at end of Glenn Highway in Anchorage. Turn left to continue south on AK-1 (Gambell St.) for the Seward Highway to Seward.

item.title: AK-1 North - Seward Highway at Glenn Highway Jct.
item.description: AK-1 north (Ingra St.) at East 6th Ave. Turn right to continue north on AK-1 as the Glenn Highway. The Glenn Highway starts at this intersection and runs northeast to Glenallen.
